tweets.text:
It's Monday, must be time for another @EnvAgency failure.

"Farmers on average receive a pollution inspection from the Environment Agency every 263 years.

https://t.co/VMQ2CkIp4M

üåßÔ∏è River levels are rising on the River Wansbeck at the Morpeth river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall from Storm Alex. @EnvAgency are monitoring river level forecasts closely.

For the latest head to > https://t.co/rwRxLL7S2h

#FloodAlert https://t.co/Sbp9QFEx78

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: There are still 10 flood warnings in place across the South West. Check your flood risk at https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/aOShDwF74o

Due to the heavy rain and rising water levels in main rivers this weekend we are using Monksleaze Clyce and the SOWY flood relief channel to divert excess water out of the Parrett. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/CFtT9ef0EC
Any chance of turning the pumping stations on and opening the sluice gates please @CastlePointBC it‚Äôs stopping our pitch from draining @ConcordRangers üò°‚öΩÔ∏è https://t.co/KILCBYi9mM

Hope @EnvAgency develop backbone & protect environment. Their determination on changes to water abstraction permits needed due to pollution risk from @HS2ltd work pushed back to Jan 2021 ‚ÄúDue to a number of complex issues‚Äù 1st sign of a vertebra or an attempt to bury the problem.

Lunt Meadows NR is closed closed until further notice. River Alt has overtopped at the spillway as per design but has breached at 2 further points undermining the bank. Visitors should not enter from any entrance & especially not walk on the river bank @EnvAgency  @LivEchonews https://t.co/JSybmCojnd
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G
@blackstarnestor @EnvAgency They‚Äôve got plenty of teeth, they just refuse to bite.
Wettest 24h since 2008 here sweetcorn flooded where @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW pumps can‚Äôt keep up for 3 time this year https://t.co/6y4ZX6CItX

More good news at #Avonmouth. Yet another fire at @SimsMM those of secret meeting with cllrs and no prosecutions for multiple breaches of the law. No warnings to local residents #CoverdUpAgain @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency https://t.co/cZ7mDhg3fp

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
7.30am, Monday

We still have a sprinkling of flood alerts and some flood warnings across our region... 

...although conditions ARE, thankfully, improving...

You can get advice anytime on being prepared for flooding or dealing with it: https://t.co/aMPFhoaKkF 
#floodaware https://t.co/qgZe5MqmU7

Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

Still in shock, thankfully we evacuated elderly family members in time thanks to @LondonFire. Never witnessed this kind of flooding in our area before

Hoping that @Hillingdon @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency can clear the riverways ASAP so we can return to our homes safely!

Please share https://t.co/6Sjkqt7Ceh

tweets.text:
Great progress has been made to dredge the Steeping River and the Wainfleet relief channel.

https://t.co/0xOqxHqZgB

Work only possible thanks to contributions from partners @LincolnshireCC, @eastlindseyDC, @NFUEastMidlands, @W4IDB, @robertcaudwell  @wendybowkett @wmcidb https://t.co/WkH2ii8qrF
@Ian_R_ @SimsMM @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency Do they alert the public with sirens? What‚Äôs the @sandyhruthven Greens saying on this ?

Flood alerts have been issued on lower Ure & Ouse. Riverside floodgates in York being closed & Foss barrier expected to come down shortly. Selby lock gates going in for high tides. 
Floodgates in Boroughbridge closed. 
EA officers patrolling Ripon & Catterick flood storage areas. https://t.co/Ta3lQywK5P

Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency The Colne near us is not a pretty sight either after all the rain

Flood alerts and warnings out in the south due to #StormAlex. In Yorks & North East, rain expected to continue throughout today and tomorrow. Check your flood risk and sign up to our free flood warning service: https://t.co/xADRoYQTUa https://t.co/F3jhn06gmR

What a deluge since Friday - flood warnings @EnvAgency @ScottishEPA  @NatReswales in force after over 100mm fell across southern England, Wales and E Scotland üåßÔ∏èüíßüçÉ
Today - not as chilly with sunny spells but Northern Ireland and N Wales look wet, showers elsewhere.

Field teams are on the ground again today checking structures and clearing trash screens etc. We are also proactively managing flows on the Parrett by using Monksleaze Clyse and the Sowy system. @EnvAgencySW @GaryBCutts https://t.co/9wkmpRSEs2

Please...please...just don‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt imagine there‚Äôs a safe ford anywhere in the patch after the last couple of days. It is simply not worth it. #floodaware #DriveToSurvive https://t.co/q7NwrJTIYp

tweets.text:
If you've a brief respite from the rain, good...

...but more forecast Monday and Tuesday... 

We clear rivers of debris to reduce flood-risk... 

...and you can get advice from our website: https://t.co/4Uyg8MonsT... 

What to do before, during and after flooding... #floodaware https://t.co/GMc6ciCBNd

#TeamEA engineers will be onsite tomorrow to undertake a detailed inspection of the river bank at Lunt Meadows Nature Reserve.  

Follow advice of @Lancswildlife belowüëá https://t.co/mbLl9NYCiZ

Upstream flow gauge back online nowüëçWell done @EnvAgencySE. Currently 220 m3/sec at #teddington weir. River is flowing quickly, fair amount of debris coming downstream too (tree stumps etc, not just bottles), probably washed out of gardens as the level rises. #twickenham

Due to increased river levels in York the Foss Barrier has been lowered. It‚Äôs job is to stop the dominant river, the Ouse, backing up the Foss and increasing flood risk. Powerful pumps push the Foss water into a culvert so it can flow into the Ouse. https://t.co/PuVgYqJzH2
